subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=2|rs=毋01}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Usage notes
subSections.text: In isolation, the character {{lang|ja|母}} has 5 strokes in modern Japanese – it is not simplified. In {{l|ja|新字体|sc=Latn|shinjitai}} compound characters, such as {{ja-l|毎}} or {{ja-l|海}}, it is simplified to 4 strokes, as {{ja-l|毋}}, but this simplification is not used in isolation. In {{l|ja|表外字|sc=Latn|hyōgaiji}} characters such as {{ja-l|姆}}, however, the component is not simplified.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|はは|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Only ever used to refer to one's own mother when speaking to someone else. Still widely used in modern {{cog|ja|-}}.

subSections.title: Antonyms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|父|ちち|[[father]]}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|はわ}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=はわ|-}}. See etymology for ''haha'' above for details.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|はわ}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Obsolete in mainstream {{cog|ja|-}}. May persist in dialects.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|は}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=は|-}}. Possibly an abbreviation of ''haha'', or possibly the original form.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|は}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Not found in isolation, only found in compounds. Obsolete and unused in modern {{cog|ja|-}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あも}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=あも|-}}. Obsolete and unused in modern {{cog|ja|-}}. Already falling into disuse by the writing of the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' in 759, where it is only found in pieces written in eastern dialects.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{cog|ko|엄마||mother}}, {{m|ko|어머니||mother}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|あも}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おも}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=おも|-}}. Obsolete and unused in modern {{cog|ja|-}}. Appears to be an alteration from ''amo'' above.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|おも}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{sense|wet nurse}} {{ja-r|乳母|うば}}

subSections.title: Etymology 6
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かか}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 7
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かあ}}

Alteration of ''kaka''<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>: {{IPAchar|/kaka/}} → {{IPAchar|/-kka/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaː/}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かあ}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かあ}}

# [[mother]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Almost never seen in isolation. Most commonly seen with honorific prefix ''o-'' and honorific suffix ''-san'', as {{ja-r|お母さん|おかあさん}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
References
